title: Did Stephen King write Silence of the Lambs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good evening Som Dutt, the answer to your question is no ( he did not ). It was written by Thomas Harris. The first publication was released in the year of 1988 on the month of May and on the 19th of May to be precise. It belongs to the series named as Hannibal Lecter. It is based on thriller genre of books. The movie was released in the year of 1991, it has a 8.6/10 according to IMDB. It was directed by Jonathan Demme , not Stephen king (nor did he write it )  Have a nice evening brother and happy Navaratri.

The reclusive Thomas Harris wrote the novel. In addition to the four Hannibal Lecter novels: “Red Dragon”, “The Silence Of The Lambs”, “Hannibal”, and “Hannibal Rising”. He also wrote “Black Sunday” and “Cari Mora”. Yale alum and former teacher there, Ted Tally adapted the novel to its screenplay. Ted Tally also has writing credits for “12 Strong”, “Red Dragon”, “All The Pretty Horses”, “Before And After”, “The Juror”, “White Palace”, “The Father Clements Story”, and “Terra Nova”.

Thomas Harris wrote “Silence of the Lambs” He also wrote “Black Sunday”, which is about a terrorist attack at the Super Bowl. One thing I’ve noticed about his work is how he likes to populate the narrative with interesting and weird characters, both good and bad.
